intro: Sisyrinchium scabrum, commonly known as roughleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces a basal rosette of leaves and has a fibrous root system. Sisyrinchium scabrum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
